review_title: The company has grown so much and is managed poorly
job_title: Case Manager in Kansas City, MO
pros: Many good staff, benefits are competitive. ReDiscover has numerous locations which gives employees opportunities to change jobs within the organization.
cons: Many of the programs are poorly managed, resulting in stress for employees. The work environment is sour, as there can be gossip, office politics and favoritism. The HR department works for leadership and there is nobody to go to for help when an employee is having a problem within management. Turnover of employees, many of the programs are short staffed. Long work hours, large client case loads. Leadership is very detached from employee needs. The focus is on making money rather than serving the needs of clients.

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Lees Summit, MO
pros: A majority of the clients are nice, the job itself is pretty basic.
cons: Absolutely cancerous administrative staff. Toxic, negative, micro aggression so thick you can feel it in the air. Of course during interviews people tell you what they want you to hear. You'd think working in non profit the employees would be kind but it's a bunch of overworked has-beens that probably needed to retire years ago. Veteran staff are so cynical. Providers like doctors/therapists are pretty top tier but everyone else is absolute garbage. Compensation is average at best.

job_title: Program Manager in Kansas City, MO
pros: The overworked line staff, lots of training
cons: ReDiscover should be taught in business schools as exactly the wrong way to do mental health care.   While stressed out clinicians scramble to meet ever-increasing productivity standards, untrained or indifferent managers push harder.  Managers and other leaders are endlessly trained in coaching techniques that they never use.  Cronyism is the rule, with director-level staff immune to the consequences of their incompetence despite years of visible track record.  If your friend is executive leadership, don't be concerned about little things like actually doing your job.  Raising issues to HR will definitely result in reprisal.

review_title: Meeting Needs of the People but Corporate Needs Help
job_title: Clinical Case Manager in Raytown, MO
pros: ReDiscover left a great impression on me for the work they did. They are actively solving the outreach problems in Kansas City and ensuring the best action is taken for clients. They are consistently identifying concerns, creating programs to solve those, and meeting them head on. The people I work with are amazing and there were always fun events for employees to engage with each other and client events for the clients to have fun while also meeting needs. My job as a case manager was incredibly flexible. I was able to create my own schedule and as long as I met my 40 hours and got my work done, I was golden. The pay was pretty good, too for a non-profit and me being an unlicensed social worker.
cons:
I didn't care for the engagement structure. We were required to have 15 contacts with clients per week (3/day). If you exceeded the 6-month average of those, you would get a bonus. It became stressful and at least in my department, it became about driving to see a contact instead of focusing on the actual needs of the clients. For example, I could have spent an entire 2 days in a week reaching out for resources for clients and doing office work to directly serve clients but I had to physically see 15 of them each week so it wasn't possible to get all of that done within 40 hours (overtime was a no go). Management. changed a lot and they struggled to advance people into a supervisory position, and when they finally put someone in charge of my team, she was micro-managing our whole team and bringing down the morale. I expressed my concern to upper management and nothing was ever done about it. 
The biggest problem with this company was corporate. It was a MESS. They were "restructuring" while I was there and almost everyone was new in their higher positions. The CEO seemed to change her mind a lot, company-wide trainings were failing and constantly being canceled, and policies were changing by the day it seemed. There was no clear outline of these policies ever and no clear line of communication. It was frustrating and left grey area regarding how we handled high-risk situations.

job_title: Diagnostician in Kansas City, MO
pros: None that I observed, none
cons: Management and HR do not care about their employees. They are rude, dishonest and have no empathy for employees or clients.  This place needs to be audited by the state and federal. They hide things from you, will not give you information out of your file to assist you in a difficult life journey.   H R is a dishonest and spiteful and definitely should not be trusted. I see the program manager of the program I worked with has resigned and posted some pretty negative things about Rediscover. Turnover is very high and management has no clue how to fix this issue. Community views are pretty negative towards Rediscover also.

review_title: Vindictive, bullies at Women & Children's program
